Fields.DialogueText: *KABOOM*
We're under fire! Everyone, to your positions!
Stand aside, Captain. Let me handle this.
Astoria...
These Morganas have a lot of nerve attacking my precious subordinates. Allow me to do you the honor of clearing out this infestation!
@BATTLE
What a display! I've never seen a Belle move so quickly!
Careful, Captain. Flattery will get you everywhere, you know?
I had no idea you cared for your crew to such an extent. It truly is awe-inspiring.
Of course I care! Do you know how much time and money I've invested into my workers?!
Come again?
These layabouts better think twice before shuffling off into the afterlife. I expect a legally binding will and testament naming me as the sole next of kin for all that I've done for them!
But, I thought--
I'm not about to let some trivial Morganas ruin a lifetime's worth of work!
There's the Astoria I know...
Forgive me, Captain. I got a bit heated there, didn't I? This war brings out the worst in all of us, it seems.

Fields.MenuText: I'm relieved that we have Belles to rely on.

Fields.DialogueText: Set a ship to catch a ship, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Especially the Morganas. I doubt they have a better side.

Fields.DialogueText: It's just how they're built, darling. That can't be helped.
But one's attitude can be. It's unbecoming to fly off the handle at a little pest control.

Fields.MenuText: It's brought out the best in our ships.

Fields.DialogueText: Hasn't it just? We had our thumbs on the scale before we arrived, but a war like this demands a more personal touch.
As does a healthy balance sheet, naturally.
In any case, that will be all for today. Do come by my office sometime soon and I will brief you on our upcoming mission. It shouldn't take too long.
That girl is something else...
Time is money, Captain, and I'm paid by the hour. This conversation alone has already run you somewhere in the realm of $50, so I would advise you to keep your meetings quick and sharp.
Just like me. *Wink*
What have you got for me, Captain?
Rescue operation.
Ha! Demeaning.
Missing crew.
Incompetent.
And missing captain.
Coward!
Sole survivor.
Lucky.
We'll be meeting with him soon. He may know the whereabouts of our missing sailors.
Not to mention some plum stocks and a perfect bingo board.

Fields.MenuText: Any questions?
Can you behave yourself?
You seem less than motivated...

Fields.DialogueText: Plenty. But they mostly concern our reward, so I'll keep them to myself.
You wound me, Captain! When have I ever been less than an angel in human shape?
A rescue operation, Captain? For someone that might very well belong to the sea by now?
Lives are at stake, Astoria. War isn't supposed to be profitable.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Best we take care of them before meeting with our escapee.
I suppose we could use a chronic survivor. Even if only as a shell.
@BATTLE
Why, the time investment alone...
Oh, *honey.* For everyone's sake, I hope whoever told you that is putting in an honest day's work down a mine shaft somewhere.
This guy?
That's him.
N-n-n-n-n-nice to meet you...
*Psst* Captain. This man looks as though he possesses less than the necessary upper body strength to operate a toothbrush.

Fields.MenuText: You really escaped, did you? Of your own volition?

Fields.DialogueText: Y-y-yes, Captain.
Oh, leave this to me, Captain. You'll crush him under the sheer weight of your rank.
*ALARM*
Feel free to work your magic. Leave the Morganas to us.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Do you believe your crew to still be alive?

Fields.DialogueText: Very much so. The crew worked tirelessly, day in and day out! And the captain...! The captain...

Fields.MenuText: How did you escape?

Fields.DialogueText: In all honesty, I can't quite remember. There was a massive explosion... I was in the water swimming for my life... The next thing I remember is being scooped up by that convoy ship.
How goes the...
Haha! Really?! You have to be lying!
Aha! I'm telling you, it's the truth! Cross my heart! Could I make something like that up?!
Interrogation...
Ah, Captain. You've returned. We were just discussing some of the antics our escapee here got up to on his home vessel.

Fields.MenuText: I can see you've become quite intertwined.

Fields.DialogueText: Jealous?
*ALARM*
Perhaps you could pry yourself away for five minutes to help me out.
If you insist. You - how about you go and make us some coffee while we're gone?
Sure! How do you take it?
Lots of cream, lots of sugar.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Sounds riveting...

Fields.DialogueText: It is! You wouldn't believe some of the crazy shenanigans other captains let their crew get up to. A girl can dream...

Fields.MenuText: Is that the most pressing matter at the moment?

Fields.DialogueText: It's a war, Captain. If you don't stop to smell the roses, they'll soon be trampled beneath someone's boot!
Do you mind explaining to me what's going on?
Captain, do you trust me?
More than my better judgment would like me to.
That man is as loyal to his captain as I am to you. You could sense his hesitation in outlining what exactly happened.
Go on.
In all likelihood, he will try to cover for his captain's fault. We need to extract as much salient information as we can if we are to succeed in this mission.

Fields.MenuText: Still... Do you have to be so... touchy?

Fields.DialogueText: Careful, Captain. If you talk like that, I really will start to think you're jealous.

Fields.MenuText: It's a little too sweet and saccharine for me.

Fields.DialogueText: It's called acting, Captain. A sprinkling of diabetes is just the cost of doing business.

Fields.MenuText: Do we need to know why his captain failed?

Fields.DialogueText: Best to spot these mistakes before we make them, is it not?
He's right where I want him, Captain. Have a little faith. *wink*
*ALARM*
The only thing I have faith in nowadays is that the alarm will ring at least twice daily.
Take it from me, Captain - jade is *not* your color.
@BATTLE
Sorry about that. Something came up.
Your coffee.
Thank you! How sweet.
Are you talking about me or the coffee?
Cheeky.
*Ahem*
Right, where were we? Oh, you were telling us about the wreckage. What happened to the captain?
Please...?
He abandoned ship at the first sign of conflict. As he scrabbled to the life boats, several crew followed behind him. There wasn't enough space for me...
How awful...
I dove into the sea and started swimming. That's all I know...
And that's all we need.
Excuse me?
Captain. We have a jumped-up weasel of a sailor to rescue who will likely be nothing more than a burden. Your orders?

Fields.MenuText: We'll rescue him, but we don't have to enjoy doing it.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, I won't.

Fields.MenuText: We'll have our friend here draw us a map of the likely location.

Fields.DialogueText: We may have to draw it ourselves. I doubt this one could wrestle a stick figure out of a pencil.

Fields.MenuText: We continue as planned. Anything more this man can tell us will be helpful.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll get what you need, rest assured.
Wait! I thought--!
You thought what? That we would elope and say goodbye to this war-torn world? We have no problem throwing you overboard as soon as your intel well runs dry, so you'd be advised to keep talking.
But...
You may have escaped, but it's your own failure to recognize incompetence that got you into this mess in the first place. I picked a captain who would never act with such dereliction.
I never knew you felt that way about--
Not now, Captain, I'll be sure to pat your back in private later.
Are we clear?
Yes, Ma'am.
Excellent. Now, you be a good little boy and there might even be some coin in it for you.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
So, this is where you last saw your captain?
That's right. I remember swimming away from this rock formation, but I have no idea what direction.
That should be fine. We'll follow the convoy ship's route and have you point out any memorable landmarks. Can you do that?
I think so.
Good boy.
Um!
Hm?
I was wondering...
Spit it out, time is money.
About what you said earlier. I think I lined up behind the wrong leader. I was wondering if... perhaps... you would accept my transfer.
Did you hear what I--
I don't know why you're looking at me. Captain? Have you been following along?

Fields.MenuText: Astoria certainly seems charmed by you. Why not?

Fields.DialogueText: "Charmed" may be pushing it...

Fields.MenuText: I would want your captain's approval first, and something tells me I'd struggle to attain it.

Fields.DialogueText: I may be many things, but a thief is not one of them. I pay my own way.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Let's take them out!
Only if they're paying.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I have. We're taking on crew, Astoria, not a servant.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, obviously, Captain. I dress servants better than the Navy does.
Astoria? A word?
Yes, Captain.
That was quite the display you gave back there to our little sprout.
All in the name of business, Captain. I'm sure someone like you has had to get their hands dirty at one time or another.

Fields.MenuText: Where did you learn such manipulative techniques?

Fields.DialogueText: "How to Win Friends and Influence People." Give it a read sometime.

Fields.MenuText: You would know a thing or two about spoils of war.

Fields.DialogueText: A portion of which is earmarked for the crew's enrichment.
Enrichment, Captain, not idleness. They're lucky they aren't paid in scrip.

Fields.MenuText: I'm as clean as a whistle.

Fields.DialogueText: Whistles have to go in mouths, Captain.
Just make sure you use your powers for good and not evil.
We're engaged on enough fronts, Captain. You need a status quo to fight from, and one should spare no expense in stamping out dissent.
You sound like a certain mustached would-be painter I know.
Oh, heavens no, Captain! I would never impose my will on anyone! It's all about helping people realize what they *should* be doing.
Perhaps you could teach me the art some time.
I'd be happy to!
If the price is right, of course. *wink*
*ALARM*
Morganas! I don't suppose you could persuade them to leave our territory?
I'm afraid the Morganas speak only one language, Captain. Luckily, I'm fluent!
@BATTLE
You cut six of those bonuses last week!
Those sailors were on liberty.
For loitering.
Is that the same rock formation you mentioned earlier?
That's the one, but I doubt they're still here. After all, how long has it been since we--
HEYYYY!
Captain!
Took you long enough!

Fields.MenuText: Calm down, Captain. My name is--

Fields.DialogueText: This is no time for pleasantries!

Fields.MenuText: Why are you still--

Fields.DialogueText: Do you think I'm moving an inch into those Morgana-infested waters?!

Fields.MenuText: We'll be right--

Fields.DialogueText: And see that you do it quickly!
What a charming fellow...
Shall we leave him for the Morganas to snack on? "Captain savaged by man-eating piranhas." We could forge some pictures, drum up a story, and sell the headline for a pretty profit.
We're coming, sir!
Unfortunately, I don't think our guests will pose for any of our shots.
Morganas! Allow me to deal with them, Captain.
@BATTLE
And anyway, piranhas are freshwater fish...
What took you so long?
Apologies, sir. We were busy engaging the enemy in combat. It can be quite a grueling process, as you may be unaware.
Watch your mouth. Ensign, I see you wasted no time in spinning a tapestry of lies. Don't think an apology will keep you from the brig.
Yes, sir!
And you, Missy, need to learn some manners and respect those of higher authority. You're not pretty enough to get away with speaking to people like that.

Fields.MenuText: *Concerned wink?*

Fields.DialogueText: *Troubled wink and smile*

Fields.MenuText: Aboard my ship, no one will talk to--

Fields.DialogueText: No, Captain. He's right. My apologies.

Fields.MenuText: That's enough, the pair of you!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm the one who provoked him. I apologize.
I'm starved. Is there anything to eat aboard this hunk of metal, or do you all subsist on sarcasm?
*Gritting teeth* Let... me... show... you... to... your... room...
There's a good girl. Finally learned to control yourself, have you? And about time too. I won't have you wasting a precious second of mine.
*PSST* Astoria, are you going to be all right with him?
Jumped-up infant. Well, like any infant, he's easily distracted.
*ALARM*
Be a doll and meet me after the battle, Captain? I'd like to show you something.
We'll meet in my quarters. Dismissed.
@BATTLE
And what do you think of THIS outfit, Captain?
It's dazzling. As were the last twenty...
Right?! Am I a sight for sore eyes or what?!

Fields.MenuText: Is this about what the captain said?

Fields.DialogueText: Whatever gave you that idea...?

Fields.MenuText: You look great, Astoria. But you already know that.

Fields.DialogueText: Oho, Captain, I had no idea you were so forward. I could get used to it.

Fields.MenuText: Why do you own so many outfits?

Fields.DialogueText: It's about making a statement. You have to inspire the people, and there's no better inspiration than envy.
Don't take what the captain said to heart. He likely wasn't speaking from his... that, or he may not possess one at all.
What are you thinking, Captain? Astoria can dish it out but she can't take it? Please...
Of course not.
Would you be chipper as the morning magpies if someone had insulted your looks?
For what it's worth, I think you're beautiful. Inside and out.
... How the tables turn. What is it with my bad luck with captains recently? I'm supposed to be the one in control, you know?
*ALARM*
Then I'll allow you to take the lead!
With pleasure!
@BATTLE
What a trip! I'll be glad to be rid of that irritating, conniving--!
*COUGH COUGH COUGH COUGH*
Dashingly handsome young captain.
Yeah, yeah, don't butter me up unless you intend to eat me. You're not getting rid of us that easily.
Pardon me?
Unless you forgot, we have no ship! We'll be sticking with you while you transport us back home.
This has to be some kind of cruel joke...
Pick up some supplies while we're docked, would ya? I'm famished and I already cleared out all your emergency rations.
I don't think I can do it, Captain.
Hey, buck up. That's not the Astoria I know.
*Sigh* Although, he is right. We expended a lot of firepower in our rescue mission. Do you think we need to resupply?

Fields.MenuText: We should grab some essentials, yes.

Fields.DialogueText: Dinner and a bomber! You ARE good to me, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Do you plan on fronting the cost?

Fields.DialogueText: You can't expect ME to foot the bill, Captain. I'm not that kind of girl.
Are you two still nattering? Hurry and dispatch those Morganas circling the exit so we can get a move on!
@BATTLE
Why did we ever listen to that man?!
We could have snuck past those Morganas - now we're being tailed to what appears to be the end of the earth.
It's over! Every man for himself!

Fields.MenuText: Please try and calm down.

Fields.DialogueText: "Stay calm!" With a Morgana's barrel pointed at my head, you tell me to "stay calm!" I'm surprised you made it this far with such obviously fake bravado!

Fields.MenuText: Nothing for it. We'll take them on!

Fields.DialogueText: Do you have a death wish?!

Fields.MenuText: That's not the way we operate aboard this ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Preach to me about the power of friendship after we escape from these vile beasts!
Astoria!
I'm right beside you, Captain! Let's speak in private after all this is said and done.
@BATTLE
The engine room has become our base of operations, hasn't it?
Why did you ask me down here?
It's about the rescued captain.
I know you don't like him, but all we can do is grin and--
It isn't that. That one's an eight-ulcer man on four-ulcer pay, but there's something far more concerning swimming about my mind.
And that is?
That man is not fit for war. I can see now why only one sailor with any sense made it out alive.
I wondered why he was alone in that life raft. The sailor said no one else could fit, so where was the rest of the crew?
It's a serious accusation, but he strikes me as a serious man when he wants to be.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't want to say it out loud.

Fields.DialogueText: That's why you hired me.

Fields.MenuText: He'll never admit it.

Fields.DialogueText: We don't need him to. Even if it isn't true, and the crew met their fate through natural means, we'll operate under the assumption that our captain is a murderer.

Fields.MenuText: How awful...

Fields.DialogueText: War makes monsters of us all.
So you want to confront the captain and lecture him about how fear has no place on the battlefield?
Hm? Did you forget who you're talking to, Captain? I plan to sit on this information until the opportune moment arrives.
Why am I not surprised?
I'm very interested in this man's career. I'm sure what's left of his crew will be happy to bare their souls. For the right price. *wink*
*ALARM*
We're all going to die!
We'd better secure the lifeboats.
You're telling me. He can't afford a space.
@BATTLE
It's nice to be able to sit and eat in peace for once.
Hear, hear.
It is the bravery of my father and my father's father that allows us to enjoy this meal. You should both be grateful.
And what of your bravery, sir, as you clearly value the quality so much?
Harumph! They died to ensure a peaceful life for the next generation! To squander their efforts by risking my life would be an insult!
*ALARM*
We'd best be going. The reaper's icy touch doesn't stave itself off.
Yes, yes, be sure to tell him hello from me.
@BATTLE
Thank goodness. He looks to have finished his meal and left.
He's not growing on you at all?
The man is as hypocritical as they come!

Fields.MenuText: Perhaps it's his upbringing.

Fields.DialogueText: You mean they *make* people like him? Good heavens, this country really has gone downhill.

Fields.MenuText: I've never seen someone provoke you so much.

Fields.DialogueText: What do we pay him for, Captain? Is this the caliber of man I can expect from back home?

Fields.MenuText: Try not to let him bother you.

Fields.DialogueText: Money can't buy serenity, Captain. Not any way you'd approve of, at any rate. Although we are in international waters...
Well, that's not very patriotic of you.
Oh, please. My commitment to my country isn't on trial here.
Besides, what sort of citizen would I be if I didn't use every tool at my disposal to build a better one?
You've got a broad definition of "tool."
It's called innovation, Captain, darling. Perhaps it's time I flexed it.
Good morning to you all!
You seem awfully chipper.
Is there anything we can do to stop it?
Word from the mainland is that my investments are booming! At this rate, I'll be a millionaire before nightfall.
You trade as well?
But of course. It's only natural a man of my standing would seek to increase his wealth.
Maybe you could give him some tips, Astoria?
That won't be necessary. Don't worry, I won't forget about my saviors. A hearty gift basket shouldn't make too much of a dent in my fortune, GWAHAHA!

Fields.MenuText: Astoria...?

Fields.DialogueText: Hm? Something the matter, Captain? You'll have to speak up, I'm having trouble hearing you.

Fields.MenuText: I don't like that look in your eye...

Fields.DialogueText: It's rude to comment on a lady's physical features, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Should I ask what you're planning?

Fields.DialogueText: If you don't want to be incriminated, then I would advise against it.
*ALARM*
Be a doll and start the fight without me, would you, Captain? There's something I must urgently attend to.
Oh, well, if it's urgent! *sigh*
@BATTLE
Horrible morning to you all!
You seem awfully depressed.
Is there anything we can do to prolong it?
My stocks have tanked! At this rate, I'll be broke before breakfast! How could things have gone south so quickly!?

Fields.MenuText: What did you do?!

Fields.DialogueText: Me? Little old me? I'm nothing but a semi-pretty face, at least according to our guest over there.

Fields.MenuText: Did you play a part in this?

Fields.DialogueText: What a wild accusation, Captain! True... but wild nonetheless!

Fields.MenuText: Should I ask?

Fields.DialogueText: I do wish you would.
Okay, enough games. Spill it.
It's nothing that couldn't have occurred naturally. I merely found out what the captain had been investing in, sent a few of my birdies to spread some rumors, and drove down the share price.
All in 24 hours?!
On the other hand, the rival company *I've* invested in has been having a wonderful week.
Remind me to never get on your bad side...
Oh? It would be a lot more fun if you did.
I demand we make a stop at the nearest town so I can make some calls and sell what little I have left!
*ALARM*
Are you deaf?! I won't meet my maker before crawling out of this debt! Handle it!
@BATTLE
While the captain is trying to climb his way out of a loan shark battering, shall we stock up on munitions, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: It would be wise. We'll be doing most of the heavy lifting from here on out, it seems.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, perhaps he can be persuaded to volunteer his quarters for shell storage.
Despite how much you dislike our guest, Astoria, I feel you two share a lot in common.
I thought you didn't want to get on my bad side, Captain.
Forgive me. It's just... you both love stocks, you both love money, and you both look out for number one.
Forgive ME, Captain but I just can't see it...
Forget I said anything. Let's load up and take care of any obstructing Morganas.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: You're not concerned about our guest turning up in worse condition than we found him in?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, come now, Captain, it's not like we're the ones breaking his knees.
Nobody's knees are getting broken while I'm captain.
Well, I'm glad *someone's* volunteered to teach him investment acumen.
We've received word that a horde of Morganas are up ahead. They're blocking the only route to the captain's home base.
You intend to take us on a suicide mission?! You incompetent--!
Zip it! Mommy and Daddy are talking. Go on, Captain.
We'll have to fight our way through if we want to return you to where you came from.
Alternatively, I've reserved you a space on a lifeboat if you'd like to attempt another daring escape.
Why you little... I'll have you both suspended for this! Endangering the life of a senior naval officer is a high-grade offense!
It was your cowardice that landed you in hot water in the first place!

Fields.MenuText: Astoria!

Fields.DialogueText: No, Captain, it needs to be said!

Fields.MenuText: That's enough!

Fields.DialogueText: I can't bite my tongue any longer!

Fields.MenuText: What happened to not letting your emotions get the better of you?

Fields.DialogueText: I can't deny my emotions, Captain - disgust least of all!
Let's make a deal. If we successfully return you safe and sound back home, you fork over your entire wealth to my name.
And if you fail?
I'll be your personal attendant in Hell. I look forward to fanning the flames away from your steadily balding head.
You think I'll agree to such--
And I'll sign a contract today naming you my next of kin. Feel free to escape while we fight for our lives and claim your reward should you reach land.
I am a gambling man. You've got yourself a deal. I'll draw up the contract immediately. As you were.
Astoria, that display was completely--!
Phew! What a show, huh?
Astoria?
Hm? Oh, come on, Captain, it will take more than a pompous loudmouth to make me blow my top. After we make it through the battle, we could use a nice little cash injection, no?
*ALARM*
Here they come! I'd best get started! Don't wait up! *Wink*
@BATTLE
I'll even give you a discount.
Keep it steady, Captain! You're doing great!
As are you!
Well, I'll be damned... You're doing it...

Fields.MenuText: This is what happens when you believe in your crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Is that so?

Fields.MenuText: Any words of wisdom?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm speechless...

Fields.MenuText: Pick your jaw up, Captain.

Fields.DialogueText: Cocky little...
I'd prefer the payment in cash, Captain. Just make sure you--
Look out!
*KABOOM*
That was close...
Thank you, Captain!
Well, don't let up yet! There's a fleet advancing from the left and several more trying to ambush us from behind!
Finally earning your rank, aren't you?
Let's close this deal!
@BATTLE
Sweet beautiful gravel, I thought I would never get to touch you again! *MWAH*
Did you just kiss the ground?
Never mind that. A deal's a deal. I'll have my people set up some kind of transfer. You'll get your money along with my letter of resignation.
Wait - I hadn't actually expected that you would keep your word. Surprising but admirable.
I have no intention of leaving the war effort, but you helped me realize that I can support those braver than me from the sidelines.
You don't seem as bad as I've forecasted. With all respect, what really happened to your crew?
*Sigh* I rushed to the lifeboats in order to ensure my survival. I have stocks, properties, and more that need protecting back home. In that moment, I thought my life alone tallied more than my crew.

Fields.MenuText: But your crewman said the life rafts were full.

Fields.DialogueText: He did, and they were. Those that survived the attack, anyway.

Fields.MenuText: I won't forgive you for what you did. Just make sure you succeed in making amends.

Fields.DialogueText: I will.
I can't take back what I did, but I can atone... somewhat.

Fields.MenuText: No man's life is worth more than another's.

Fields.DialogueText: I can see that now.
You know, I was worried when the Captain said I was like you. Now that worry has been put to rest.
How so?
I'm nothing like you. Money means nothing if you hoard it. It's got to move to make the world go round.
Enjoy your stacks of colorfully printed paper, sir. I'm sure they'll make for pretty decorations on your gravestone.
That girl is something else... A real pain in the backside. Although I do like a woman who can put me in my place. Do me a favor.
Another one? Business folks have an interesting way of showing gratitude...
When this war is said and done, be sure to give her my contact information. I can think of a few pricey restaurants that would be sure to win her heart.
Uh... I'm not sure that she would--
Unless, of course, you've already won it?
... Good day, Captain. I need to get back to the ship and clear out any Morganas blocking our exit.
Take hold of what is special to you and never let it go! For me, that is money.
@BATTLE
... You're in luck. It seems the Captain will be working off your bill.
Surprising, but admirable. Maybe you should waive his debt.
You take that back.
He saved you the trouble of hiring debt collectors, after all.
That's not what I-
So, what now?
We're nearly ready to set sail, Captain.
It will be good to get out onto the sea again.
What shall we do with the captain's money?
Wait. I don't have to work it off anymore?
He wanted an early start on making amends. I can only object half-heartedly for so long. Any ideas?

Fields.MenuText: We'll restock. That last battle really took it out of us.

Fields.DialogueText: I love people who have money and know how to spend it!

Fields.MenuText: We'll save it. For a rainy day.

Fields.DialogueText: The sun will always shine on me, Captain. I fear this money will never see the light of day with such an attitude.
Take care of any Morganas circling the exit, would you?
Aye-aye!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Well, we'd better invest it. We've got to make that money work for us.

Fields.DialogueText: Spoken like a captain of industry. I know a Pinkerton or two who can protect those investments.
We've got enough to worry about out here without whipping up a strike back home.
Didn't you hear about the no-strike pledge? We're in the clear.
Well, not during a rainy--
Stick to meteorology, Captain, and let me hold the purse strings.
What a long few weeks it's been.
As much as I complained throughout our journey, I'm glad it happened.
Why's that?
I don't know if you realized, Captain, but I'm something of a penny pincher.
You?! No!
I know, I know, it's hard to believe but I'm telling you that it's true. Just... Seeing what money can do to someone. It made me realize...

Fields.MenuText: You should give all your money to charity?
You should look more toward inner peace than monetary gain?
The real prize was the friends we made along the way?

Fields.DialogueText: Let's not get crazy now, Captain.
I'm no Buddhist, Captain. I can't very well pay for my meals with meditation, now, can I?
This isn't a public service announcement, Captain.
Well, what then?
*ALARM*
I'll tell you after I take out these Morganas.
@BATTLE
As you were saying?
Right. Looking at the way that captain's life turned out, it really struck a chord with me. I mean, we are very similar!
Funny, I remember someone saying something like that...
But now I can see why our lives are so different.
Care to enlighten me?
It's you, Captain. You keep me grounded. Keep me from straying to far off the right path. Money is important, but I suppose there's space in my life for those it can't buy...

Fields.MenuText: I didn't do anything special.

Fields.DialogueText: Without even realizing, you've helped me more than you could ever know.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not a monk who can define right from wrong.

Fields.DialogueText: Then it must be in your blood.

Fields.MenuText: You make me sound so boring.

Fields.DialogueText: Wonderfully boring, Captain! Without you to keep my feet on the ground, my ego would have floated into the heavens by now!
I don't know if I inherently agree with what you're saying, but... you're welcome?
*ALARM*
Would you care to join me?
Do I have a choice?
@BATTLE
Keep at it! We're nearly there!
@BATTLE
I'm glad to see you turning over a new leaf, Astoria.
It's a new leaf in a well-worn ledger, Captain. Just, if you see me becoming more and more like that captain, please bonk me over the head. *wink*
You sure know how to hedge your bets.
Well, after receiving such a hearty sum of money that I've been discouraged from touching...
I just thought we should save some of it, that's all...
I thought it would be nice to set my eyes on the future.

Fields.MenuText: And what will you do after making your millions?

Fields.DialogueText: Whatever else? You've got to spend money to make money!

Fields.MenuText: Can I expect one of those bonuses?

Fields.DialogueText: That depends on your monthly performance report, Captain. I'm not one for handouts.

Fields.MenuText: Good luck.

Fields.DialogueText: Luck is for those who don't read the business press.
I hope I get to be there when you make it happen. If it's you, I know you can do it.
You plan to stay with me that long? Are you sure you can trust me?

Fields.MenuText: If I'm being manipulated, I've loved every minute of it so far.

Fields.DialogueText: Haha! Likewise!

Fields.MenuText: I'd like to think so. I'll stay with you for as long as it takes. If you'll have me.

Fields.DialogueText: Hm? Let me check my schedule. I'm sure I can pencil in an eternity together.
Then what say you, Astoria? Business partners?
Honestly, Captain... You are something else!
